segment.source: Use the Properties tab to view basic statistical information about a sequenced application package.
segment.target: Use the Properties tab to view basic statistical information about a sequenced application package.

segment.source: The information is automatically generated unless otherwise noted.
segment.target: The information is automatically generated unless otherwise noted.

segment.source: This tab contains the following elements.
segment.target: This tab contains the following elements.

segment.source: The single name used for a sequenced application package that might contain one or more applications—for example, Microsoft Office could be used to label a sequenced application package that contains Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel applications that run in the same virtual environment.
segment.target: The single name used for a sequenced application package that might contain one or more applications—for example, Microsoft Office could be used to label a sequenced application package that contains Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel applications that run in the same virtual environment.

segment.source: Displays a short description of the software package that will appear in the Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file ABSTRACT element.
segment.target: Displays a short description of the software package that will appear in the Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file ABSTRACT element.

segment.source: The globally unique identifier (GUID) automatically assigned to the sequenced application package to distinguish it from other sequenced application packages that might be running on the computer to which a sequenced application package is streamed.
segment.target: The globally unique identifier (GUID) automatically assigned to the sequenced application package to distinguish it from other sequenced application packages that might be running on the computer to which a sequenced application package is streamed.

segment.source: The sequenced application package version GUID.
segment.target: The sequenced application package version GUID.

segment.source: The directory on the sequencing computer in which files for the sequenced application package are installed.
segment.target: The directory on the sequencing computer in which files for the sequenced application package are installed.

segment.source: This directory is also created on the computer to which a sequenced application package will be streamed.
segment.target: This directory is also created on the computer to which a sequenced application package will be streamed.

segment.source: It is recommended for backwards compatibility that this be an 8.3 format directory name at the root of the Q drive, such as Q:MyApp.1.
segment.target: It is recommended for backwards compatibility that this be an 8.3 format directory name at the root of the Q drive, such as Q:MyApp.1.

segment.source: The date and time the sequenced application package was created.
segment.target: The date and time the sequenced application package was created.

segment.source: The date and time the sequenced application package was last modified.
segment.target: The date and time the sequenced application package was last modified.

segment.source: The size of the package in megabytes.
segment.target: The size of the package in megabytes.

segment.source: The size in megabytes of the portion of the SFT file that is required to start the application.
segment.target: The size in megabytes of the portion of the SFT file that is required to start the application.

segment.source: Specifies the size of the primary and secondary feature blocks into which the SFT file is divided for streaming across a network.
segment.target: Specifies the size of the primary and secondary feature blocks into which the SFT file is divided for streaming across a network.

segment.source: All blocks equal the specified size; however, the last block might be smaller than specified.
segment.target: All blocks equal the specified size; however, the last block might be smaller than specified.

segment.source: You will see one of the following values:
segment.target: You will see one of the following values:

segment.source: After the initial package has been created, the block size value is not changeable.
segment.target: After the initial package has been created, the block size value is not changeable.
